original_definition: 'central stockholding entity' means the body or service upon which powers may be conferred to act to acquire, maintain or sell oil stocks, including emergency stocks and specific stocks;
generated_definition: 'central stockholding entity' means a centralized entity that holds and manages the stock of goods or services within a particular industry or sector, serving as a single point of contact for its members or stakeholders.

Article 2: ‘central stockholding entity’ (CSE) means the body or service upon which powers may be conferred to act to acquire, maintain or sell oil stocks, including emergency stocks and specific stocks;
